Clients.OffLineTool
Class AntennaStatus

java.lang.Object
  Clients.ACSClient
      Clients.OffLineTool.AntennaStatus

public class AntennaStatus
extends ACSClient

This class is responsible to get the offline antenna information, to do that, this class obtain the antenna component reference, using the client from ACSClient, get the containerservices and obtain a reference to antenna, this references is stored to reuse during the execution of the program.

Author:
Andres Villalobos, 2011 Summerjob, Ingenieria de ejecucion en Computacion e Informatica, Universidad Catolica del norte
See Also:
The project Twiki page and my Dailylog please Contact to a.e.v.r.007@gmail.com

Constructor Detail

AntennaStatus

public AntennaStatus(alma.acs.component.client.AdvancedComponentClient _client,
                     java.lang.String _brokerURL,
                     java.lang.String[] Antenna,
                     java.lang.String[] _devices)
This is the constructor of the antenna status, here obtain the name of all antennas

Parameters:
_client - The client needed by ACSClient
_brokerURL - The broker url to ActvieMQ server
Antenna - Indicate which antenna get from ACSManager, this information is on $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/Antennas file and just have the names of monitoring antennas Ex: DV01 DV02 PM03
_devices - Indicate the name of the devices that will be returned from ActiveMQ queue, this information is on $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/Devices file and just have the names of monitoring devices Ex: DV01_LLC DV01_FrontEnd
Method Detail

getStatus

public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStatus()
This is the implementation of getStatus for Antenna status, this implementation try to get the references for antennas, if there is not antennas, then try to get all references again, if there is just some references, then try to get the remaining references and in both cases, return the status of all references, if this not exist, display a message saying which was the problem

Specified by:
getStatus in class ACSClient
Returns:
A linked list on JSON format that display the needed information for antennas

getAntennaReferences

private void getAntennaReferences()
This method try to get references for the needed antennas, if is unable to get this information then display a message on ACS Logger informing the exception

getStatusFromAntennas

private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStatusFromAntennas()
This method get the information from Components and ActiveMQ and add on one report for antenna status.

Returns:
The all status of antennas (Components and ActiveMQ)

getStatusFromAntennaComponent

private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStatusFromAntennaComponent()
This method get all information from antenna components and add this information on json format on a report to be returned

Returns:
A list of string with antenna status on json format

getStatusFromActiveMQ

private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStatusFromActiveMQ()
This method get the information from antennaActiveMQMessageListener, this information must to be on JSON format and contain the relevant information for antennas

Returns:
A List of antenna status from ActiveMQ on JSON format

getReferencesOfRemainingAntennas

private void getReferencesOfRemainingAntennas()
This method try to get the information for the remaining antennas, to do that, use the key on the HashMap that contains the antenna references, and get the references, if its unable to use this reference, then this references not exist, so try to get the reference to this antenna.

getSubStatus

public java.lang.String getSubStatus(alma.Control.Antenna antenna)
This method return the subsystem status for a antenna. This method must to be chequed, because the implementation make me some doubts, actually i'm using the error message to display something here, and if there is not erro, then i'm displaying the "NoError" message

Parameters:
antenna - The reference to the antenna where sub system status is needed
Returns:

getAntennaNames

public java.lang.String[] getAntennaNames()
This method return the array of Antennas names to monitor

Returns:
An array with each antenna written on $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/Antennas

Returns:
An array with each device written on $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/Devices
